articles.headline: Child Mortality at Record Low; Further Drop Seen
articles.snippet: The number of deaths of young children around the world has fallen below 10 million a year, according to Unicef.
articles.abstract: The number of deaths of young children around the world has fallen below 10 million a year, according to Unicef.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the first time since record keeping began in 1960, the number of deaths of young children around the world has fallen below 10 million a year, according to figures from the United Nations Children’s Fund being released today.

articles.headline: A Home Loan Trap
articles.snippet: High fees for early payment can prevent escape for homeowners trying to escape from adjustable rate mortgages.
articles.abstract: High fees for early payment can prevent escape for homeowners trying to escape from adjustable rate mortgages.
articles.lead_paragraph: Homeowners whose loan rates are soaring may want to head for the exits. Many of them, though, will find no way out. If they sell their home or refinance, they will face a penalty of thousands of dollars for paying off their loans early.

articles.headline: Senators Urge More Stringent Rules for Toy Safety
articles.snippet: Robert A. Eckert, Mattel’s C.E.O., told Congress that the toy industry would work to prevent unsafe toys from entering the U.S.
articles.abstract: Robert A. Eckert, Mattel’s C.E.O., told Congress that the toy industry would work to prevent unsafe toys from entering the U.S.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 — Mattel’s chief executive apologized to Congress on Wednesday for failing to stop toys coated in lead paint from reaching consumers and vowed to take immediate steps to prevent it from happening again.

articles.headline: Euro Hits New High; Oil Nears $80 a Barrel
articles.snippet: The dollar fell to an all-time low against the euro and oil prices hit a record, suggesting higher prices for imports.
articles.abstract: The dollar fell to an all-time low against the euro and oil prices hit a record, suggesting higher prices for imports.
articles.lead_paragraph: The dollar fell to a new low point against the euro yesterday and oil prices surged to a record, suggesting that a weaker American economy would be accompanied by higher prices for energy and other imported products.

articles.headline: Compromise on Oil Law in Iraq Seems to Be Collapsing
articles.snippet: The apparent breakdown comes just as the White House is struggling to find evidence that there is progress toward a functioning government.
articles.abstract: The apparent breakdown comes just as the White House is struggling to find evidence that there is progress toward a functioning government.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Sept. 12 — A carefully constructed compromise on a draft law governing Iraq’s rich oil fields, agreed to in February after months of arduous talks among Iraqi political groups, appears to have collapsed. The apparent breakdown comes just as Congress and the White House are struggling to find evidence that there is progress toward reconciliation and a functioning government here.

articles.headline: U.S. Court Backs States’ Measures to Cut Emissions
articles.snippet: A federal judge in Vermont gave the first legal endorsement to rules in California, being copied in 13 other states, that intend to reduce greenhouse gases emitted by automobiles.
articles.abstract: A federal judge in Vermont gave the first legal endorsement to rules in California, being copied in 13 other states, that intend to reduce greenhouse gases emitted by automobiles.
articles.lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Vermont gave the first legal endorsement yesterday to rules in California, being copied in 13 other states, that intend to reduce greenhouse gases emitted by automobiles and light trucks.

articles.headline: Google Founders’ Ultimate Perk: A NASA Runway
articles.snippet: Google’s executives have secured the use of a NASA-run airstrip that is just minutes from their offices.
articles.abstract: Google’s executives have secured the use of a NASA-run airstrip that is just minutes from their offices.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 12 — In the annals of perks enjoyed by America’s corporate executives, the founders of Google may have set a new standard: an uncrowded, federally managed runway for their private jet that is only a few minutes’ drive from their offices.

articles.headline: Show Series to Originate on MySpace
articles.snippet: Two seasoned Hollywood producers have made a deal with MySpace to produce an original Web series called “Quarterlife.”
articles.abstract: Two seasoned Hollywood producers have made a deal with MySpace to produce an original Web series called “Quarterlife.”
articles.lead_paragraph: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Sept. 12 — Hollywood has been dipping its toe in original online content. Two seasoned producers are about to take a full plunge.
